Key Match Events: The Phillies won 12-2 over the New York Mets
Pre-Game Insights: The Phillies have a game to win Saturday afternoon to win their first NL East title in 13 years.
Manager Rob Thomson credited the team's staff members for their role in the team's success.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Rob Thomson said the goal is now firmly entrenched to win a World Series.
Alec Bohm said he's feeling more free and trusting his hand after missing 16 days with a strained left hand.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies have made the postseason for three straight years for only the third time in franchise history.
Alec Bohm returned to the lineup last weekend after missing 16 days with a strained left hand.
Others: The team is looking to win their first NL East title in 13 years.
Alec Bohm had four hits and four RBIs in the game.
